titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1338) to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to provide more effective remedies to victims of discrimination in the payment of wages on the basis of sex, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-807, by Ms. Slaughter.
All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived except those arising under clause 9 or 10 of rule XXI.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 256.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1388.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 1388, the Chair put the question on adoption of ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Lincoln Diaz-Balart (FL) demanded the yeas and nays, and the Chair postponed further proceedings on adoption until later in the legislative day.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 232 - 191 (Roll no. 547).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 229 - 194 (Roll no. 548).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/30/2008--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1338) to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to provide more effective remedies to victims of discrimination in the payment of wages on the basis of sex.
